content.quote: I have never killed anyone, but I have read some obituary notices with great satisfaction.
content.author: Clarence Darrow

content.quote: There are no facts, only interpretations.
content.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

content.quote: Against stupidity, the gods themselves contend in vain.
content.author: Friedrich von Schiller

content.quote: Many wealthy people are little more than janitors of their possessions.
content.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

content.quote: C makes it easy to shoot yourself in the foot; C++ makes it harder, but when you do, it blows away your whole leg.
content.author: Bjarne Stroustrup

content.quote: We have art to save ourselves from the truth.
content.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

content.quote: Not everything that can be counted counts, and not everything that counts can be counted.
content.author: Albert Einstein

content.quote: Don't stay in bed, unless you can make money in bed.
content.author: George Burns

content.quote: Life isn't about waiting for the storm to pass; it's about learning to dance in the rain.
content.author: Vivian Greene

content.quote: Blessed is the man, who having nothing to say, abstains from giving wordy evidence of the fact.
content.author: George Eliot
